issue.title: Threads: When read, doesn't leave Unreads filter view

labels.name: T-Defect
labels.description: Something isn't working: bugs, crashes, hangs and other reported problems

labels.name: S-Minor
labels.description: Impairs non-critical functionality or suitable workarounds exist

labels.name: O-Occasional
labels.description: Affects or can be seen by some users regularly or most users rarely

labels.name: A-Threads
labels.description: Message threading to simplify the Timeline

issue.body:
I got a thread message in a room, once I read it and went to the Unreads tab the message is read but the room shows in the Unreads tab still

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/89144281/202726211-df89c9bd-897b-4b83-ad9e-ed853e81ec71.jpeg)

comment.body:
I don't understand why https://github.com/matrix-org/matrix-ios-sdk/pull/1723 was reverted by https://github.com/matrix-org/matrix-ios-sdk/pull/1736 ?

Unread tabs list a lot of totally read rooms.

If i locally reapply https://github.com/matrix-org/matrix-ios-sdk/pull/1723 then unread tab only lists rooms with unread messages as attended.

Please, reapply https://github.com/matrix-org/matrix-ios-sdk/pull/1723

issue.title: Quotes are not working when the new WYSIWYG is enabled

labels.name: T-Defect
labels.description: Something isn't working: bugs, crashes, hangs and other reported problems

labels.name: S-Major
labels.description: Severely degrades major functionality or product features, with no satisfactory workaround

labels.name: O-Frequent
labels.description: Affects or can be seen by most users regularly or impacts most users' first experience

labels.name: A-Rich-Text-Editor
labels.description: Issues with the new rich text editor, also known as the WYSIWYG editor

issue.body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Enable the new WYSIWYG editor in the application settings
2. Select a message in an existing room timeline
3. Select the option "Quote"

### Outcome

#### What did you expect?
The quoted message should appear in the composer and be sent with the new message

#### What happened instead?
nothing appears in the composer, the quoted message is missing in the new sent message

Additional information:
- This issue has been filed in [matrix-rich-text-editor](https://github.com/matrix-org/matrix-rich-text-editor/issues/503) repo. But I didn't reproduce it in Element-Android v1.6.5
- This issue is reproduced on Element-web

### Your phone model

_No response_

### Operating system version

_No response_

### Application version

1.11.4

### Homeserver

_No response_

### Will you send logs?

No

comment.body:
I investigated this issue: - first in Element-Android, the quote is handled by using a dedicated sending mode UI (like Reply or Edit): The selected message text is not displayed in the composer, it is added to the typed message during the sending process: - About Element-iOS, quotes are not working with WYSIWYG, because the existing code doesn't support the RTE use case [here](https://github.com/vector-im/element-ios/blob/develop/Riot/Modules/Room/RoomViewController.m#L4071), contrary to the edition (see [here](https://github.com/vector-im/element-ios/blob/develop/Riot/Modules/Room/RoomViewController.m#L4810)) - I tested to fill the selected message body in the composer by setting a `htmlContent`. But this failed, I observed the following error `Provided HTML index is out of expected bounds` as soon as the provided string has a html tag (`
` for example) - one option would be to apply an action (`.quote`) to the composer by using [this method](https://github.com/matrix-org/matrix-rich-text-editor/blob/main/platforms/ios/lib/WysiwygComposer/Sources/WysiwygComposer/Components/WysiwygComposerView/WysiwygComposerViewModel.swift#L179), but before, an update of the rich-text-editor seems relevant

issue.title: Receiving silent and empty notifications / calls

labels.name: T-Defect
labels.description: Something isn't working: bugs, crashes, hangs and other reported problems

labels.name: S-Major
labels.description: Severely degrades major functionality or product features, with no satisfactory workaround

labels.name: O-Occasional
labels.description: Affects or can be seen by some users regularly or most users rarely

issue.body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Where are you starting? What can you see?
Receiving a message or a call

### Outcome

What did you expect?
Receiving descriptive notifications whenever an update occurs.

What happened instead?
Whenever I receive a message, I get an empty notification, it says "Notification" only and shows the app's name above it. It's also a silent one.
Also, when I receive a call I get a series of notifications similar to the described above.

Note that I'm working on a clone where the only thing changed is the sygnal url (I host my own matrix server).

### Your phone model

iPhone (multiple versions)

### Operating system version

iOS 16.6

### Application version

1.10.14

### Homeserver

Synapse

### Will you send logs?

Yes

issue.title: Receiving silent and empty notifications / calls

labels.name: T-Defect
labels.description: Something isn't working: bugs, crashes, hangs and other reported problems

labels.name: S-Major
labels.description: Severely degrades major functionality or product features, with no satisfactory workaround

labels.name: O-Occasional
labels.description: Affects or can be seen by some users regularly or most users rarely

issue.body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Where are you starting? What can you see?
Receiving a message or a call

### Outcome

What did you expect?
Receiving descriptive notifications whenever an update occurs.

What happened instead?
Whenever I receive a message, I get an empty notification, it says "Notification" only and shows the app's name above it. It's also a silent one.
Also, when I receive a call I get a series of notifications similar to the described above.

Note that I'm working on a clone where the only thing changed is the sygnal url (I host my own matrix server).

### Your phone model

iPhone (multiple versions)

### Operating system version

iOS 16.6

### Application version

1.10.14

### Homeserver

Synapse

### Will you send logs?

Yes

comment.body: @fnwtv @rumz26 yes I have been able to solve it. It turned out that I had the app groups misconfigured. Once I solved it the notifications started to work well.

forkee.name: element-ios
forkee.description: A glossy Matrix collaboration client for iOS

issue.title: The exciting launch of Element X

labels.name: T-Defect
labels.description: Something isn't working: bugs, crashes, hangs and other reported problems

issue.body:
### Steps to reproduce

Hello,

With the exciting launch of Element X, I'm curious about the support status for the original version of Element.io (this repo). Could you please clarify if the original version will continue to receive support, and if so, for how long?

Thank you for your time.

Best regards,

### Outcome

Support of Element IO

### Your phone model

_No response_

### Operating system version

_No response_

### Application version

_No response_

### Homeserver

_No response_

### Will you send logs?

Yes

comment.body: @ara4n, sorry for the late reply. The problem for us with Element X is that it not only requires new client software, but also new server software, namely Sliding Sync support, that is currently in beta. When we wanted to give it a look, following [the status issue](https://github.com/vector-im/element-meta/issues/1915), we discovered that the manual is "TODO": I am not sure of the security state of Sliding Sync support modules either. In case you might know: * Is Sliding Sync a permanent requirement? * Will synapse support Sliding Sync out of the box?

commits.message:
Release kMXKAccountAPNSActivityDidChangeNotification observer when deallocation controller

Signed-off-by: Nicolas Buquet <nbuquet@buquet-net.com>

SettingsViewController : Call Destroy on dealloc to release all observers

Signed-off-by: Nicolas Buquet <nbuquet@buquet-net.com>

Don't remove `pushInfoUpdateObserver` in dealloc because it is removed in `destroy`.

Signed-off-by: Nicolas Buquet <nbuquet@buquet-net.com>

Merge pull request #7697 from NicolasBuquet/develop

Release kMXKAccountAPNSActivityDidChangeNotification observer when de…

### Pull Request Checklist

- [X] I read the [contributing guide](https://github.com/vector-im/element-ios/blob/develop/CONTRIBUTING.md)

issue.title: Privacy: Riot iOS connects to clients3.google.com/generate_204 every 60 seconds

labels.name: T-Defect
labels.description: Something isn't working: bugs, crashes, hangs and other reported problems

labels.name: S-Minor
labels.description: Impairs non-critical functionality or suitable workarounds exist

labels.name: O-Frequent
labels.description: Affects or can be seen by most users regularly or impacts most users' first experience

labels.name: Z-Ready
labels.description: This issue is ready for development

issue.body:
When Riot iOS is opened and running in foreground, it connects to https://clients3.google.com/generate_204 every 60 seconds.

I have verified with both Charles and mitmproxy:

Charles:

![riot-ios-google-charles](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1392875/80802882-fd654980-8bb0-11ea-9563-e4b323ecdaec.png)

mitmproxy (including the User Agent just to be sure):

![riot-ios-google-mitmproxy](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1392875/80802927-1837be00-8bb1-11ea-88b5-811015e38aca.png)

From my point of view, this is a privacy concern as I would not expect the Riot iOS app to connect to Google every minute and report the used Riot Version (via user-agent HTTP header) to Google.

Based on some research the reason behind this seems to be the following.

I rebuilt the Riot iOS app and after that a grep for the URL returns that it is contained in the JitsiMeet.framework which is part of the JitsiMeetSDK:

```
grep -R clients3.google.com .
./out/Riot.xcarchive/Products/Applications/Riot.app/Frameworks/JitsiMeet.framework/main.jsbundle:__d(function(g,r,i,a,m,e,d){Object.defineProperty(e,"__esModule",{value:!0}),e.clear=h,e.update=b,e.currentState=v,e.addSubscription=S,e.default=void 0;var n='https://clients3.google.com/generate_204',t=6e4,l=5e3,u=new Set,c=null,o=null,f=null;function s(n){c!==n&&(c=n,u.forEach(function(n){n(c)}))}function p(){var u=!1;return{promise:fetch(n).then(function(n){u||(s(204===n.status),f=setTimeout(p,c?t:l))}).catch(function(){s(!1),f=setTimeout(p,l)}),cancel:function(){u=!0}}}function h(){null!==o&&(o.cancel(),o=null),null!==f&&(clearTimeout(f),f=null),u.clear()}function b(n){var t;'boolean'==typeof n.isInternetReachable?s(n.isInternetReachable):(t=n.isConnected,null!==o&&(o.cancel(),o=null),null!==f&&(clearTimeout(f),f=null),t?(c||s(null),o=p()):s(!1))}function v(){return c}function S(n){return u.add(n),function(){u.delete(n)}}var ={update:b,currentState:v,clear:h,addSubscription:S};e.default=},992,[]);
```

Digging further into that, this code seems to be from react-native-netinfo, version 4.2.1, which is used in the JitsiMeetSDK:

https://github.com/react-native-community/react-native-netinfo/blob/4371c653f0b1739d736d58a453df07712497fdc2/src/internal/internetReachability.ts

The history behind this is: Here "internet reachability detection" was added to react-native-netinfo: https://github.com/react-native-community/react-native-netinfo/pull/116

In the comments of the pull request you see that in iOS it performs the internet reachability detection every 60 seconds independent whether its used or not by the application code so that the state is current when it is first requested by an application.

react-native-netinfo was later added to the JitsiMeetSDK with this pull request: 
https://github.com/jitsi/jitsi-meet/pull/4568

A friend of mine has highlighted this to the jitsi people in https://github.com/jitsi/jitsi-meet/issues/6474, but I wanted to make you aware of it as well, as Riot is affected by this and from a users perspective the Riot app connects to google every 60 seconds.

pull_request.title: Do not connect to clients3.google.com every 60 seconds
pull_request.body:
Workaround for https://github.com/vector-im/element-ios/issues/3190,
better adjust to a element.io URL that only generates empty 204 instead of 5KB download
